    Prescription for Treating Hemorrhoids and Tumors

    To treat hemorrhoids and tumors, especially those with small stems and large heads, use a fine thread to tie at the affected root for effective results.

    Ingredients:

    • Five qian of yunhua (a medicinal herb)
    • Two qian of bijian (a type of moneywort)
    • Three qian of white fine thread

    Combine the two herbs and add one bowl of water in a small ceramic jar. Slowly boil until the liquid reduces, then dry the thread in the shade.

    For treatment, use one piece of thread for mild cases, or two for severe cases, tying at the base and leaving long ends to gradually tighten. The affected area will naturally darken to purple-black and feel cold, indicating progress. Lighter cases resolve in seven days, while heavier cases take up to fifteen days, after which they should fall off. Follow up with pearl powder to close the wound effectively.

    For treating hemorrhoids, whether new or old, particularly when there is bleeding and pain with a feeling of heaviness in the anus.

Use one or two qian of roasted Licorice and one qian of Cornelian Cherry; if there is fear of sourness, omit it. Add two zhongs of water, decoct to seven parts, and take warm away from meals. If there is insufficient original yang, with much cold, add Aconite, Cinnamon, and roasted Ginger as needed. If there is deficiency in the qi component, add Astragalus and Atractylodes; if there is excessive stagnation in the stomach, do not use these. If there is blood stagnation, add Chuanxiong and remove Cornelian Cherry. If there is loose stools, add Schisandra and the like.[97p]

    Buhas Yin Yiqi Decoction
    This is a modified version of the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction, used to treat spleen deficiency with prolapse of the rectum.

    • Ginseng: 1-3 qian
    • Angelica: 2-3 qian
    • Chinese Yam (stir-fried in wine): 2-3 qian
    • Rehmannia: 3-5 qian or 1-2 liang
    • Aged Tangerine Peel: 1 qian
    • Honey-fried Licorice: 1 qian
    • Cimicifuga: 3-5 fen, remove any that floats to the top
    • Bupleurum: 1-2 qian, remove if there is no external pathogen
    • Water: 2 zhong, add fresh ginger (3-5-7 slices), decoct for 8 minutes, warm and take away from meals.

    Juyuan Decoction
    Used for the previous condition.

    • Honey-fried Licorice: 1-2 qian
    • Cimicifuga: 5-7 fen
    • White Atractylodes (stir-fried): 1-2 qian
    • Ginseng: 3-5 qian
    • Astragalus (honey-fried): 3-5 qian
    • Water: 1.5 zhong, decoct for 7-8 minutes, take warm. If combined with Yang deficiency and cold, add cinnamon, prepared Aconite, or dried ginger as appropriate. If combined with slipping or prolapse, add 2 dried Black Plums or 7-8 fen of dried Clam.

    Chou Xin Drink
    Used for damp-heat descending with pain and rectal prolapse.

    • Scutellaria: 1-2 qian
    • Dendrobium: 1-2 qian
    • Akebia (wood vine): 1-2 qian
    • Stir-fried Gardenia: 1-2 qian
    • Coptis: 1-2 qian
    • Bitter Orange Peel: 1.5 qian
    • Water: 1.5 zhong, decoct for 7 minutes, take warm and away from meals. If there is severe internal heat, cold consumption is better. If the heat is in the blood level concerning the large intestine, add Sophora buds and Coptis to clear it. If the heat is in the lower furnace, with painful and scant urination, add gentian and Plantago for its diuretic effects. If the heat is in the Yin realm, with insufficient fluids, add Ophiopogon, Rehmannia, and Peony for nourishment. If there are solid accumulations in the intestines or stomach due to heat, add Rhubarb and Glauber's Salt to unblock it.[98p]

    Zhi Prescription

    To treat unbearable pain from hemorrhoids:

    Seven taels of the root bark of the huai tree, crushed without using iron tools; one part of borneol; seven pieces of fingernail grass (known as "mang cao" by the Shu people), about two to three inches tall, also used to feed pigs, can relieve hunger.

    Prepare one dose with two qing of water, boil until a small cup remains, then add ground borneol when warm, and frequently apply to the affected area. Internally, take huai seed wine. The prescription can still work without fingernail grass.

    Another Prescription

    For treating fleshy hemorrhoids:

    One tael each of fried huai flowers and burnt alum; five qian of aconite. Grind finely together, then form into pills the size of a tung seed, taking twenty pills with rice wine before meals, three times a day.

    Another Prescription

    To treat wind hemorrhoids, regardless of whether they are internal or external, it will settle within three days:

    Five qian each of burnt coltsfoot, dried ginger, and gastrodia; one tael each of lotus seed grass, alum, and stone sulfur; two qian of roasted soapberry thorns; a small amount of musk.

    Open a hole in the soapberry thorn, place alum and sulfur inside, the hole should be as large as a small coin, then tightly cover it, seal with paper, and store in a clay pot. Heat over charcoal until the smoke completely dissipates, then allow to cool, take out and grind finely, mix with the previous six medicinal powders, and refine into pills the size of a tung seed. Take ten to fifteen pills with warm wine on an empty stomach, three times a day, for three days for effect.

    Avoid greasy and preserved foods, beef and horse meat, fishy and cold foods, sexual activities, long journeys, and any strenuous labor during this treatment.[101p]

    Mysterious formula for treating hemorrhoids.

    Ingredients:

    • Qiang Huo
    • Dong Quai
    • Chuan Xiong

    • Chai Hu
    • Wei Pi, stir-fried

    Preparation: Take two or three seeds of Ba Dou, place inside Zhi Ke, tie securely, then boil in vinegar until tender, wash in cold water, remove Ba Dou, do not dry out.     Bitter Melia Fruit

    Grind finely and mix with wine to form pills the size of a phoenix tree seed. Take thirty pills each time, wash down with a decoction of hollow heart celosia, three times a day.

    Leakage Divine Elixir

    Take half a tael of Chuanxiong, two and a half qian each of finely prepared spicy herb and white atractylodes sprouts, and a small amount of licorice powder. Make a decoction daily, taking it after meals for external sores and before meals for internal sores. Observe the size of the sore openings; use aged ramie roots to scrape off the rough skin and pound them soft, twist into a string, and insert into the opening until resistance is felt. As the opening shallows day by day, apply a good plaster to the sore.

    Dried Medicinal Formula

    One red-foot centipede, fried in spike oil; five qian of human fingernail; two qian each of frankincense and myrrh; and half a qian each of musk and talcum. Except for the musk which should be ground separately, mix the others into a paste and dry them. Use a goose feather tube to blow the mixture onto the affected area. If any fluid is present, this will drain out immediately without pain.

    Fumigation and washing prescription:
    Fivefold gall, (stone) saltpeter, mulberry mistletoe, lotus seed, and schizonepeta; prepare decoction, first fumigate then wash.

    Detoxification prescription:
    Gardenia, rhubarb, frankincense, myrrh, and angelica, each five parts; three qian of (Herba) lohua seeds, and one qian of daizhi stone; all make one dose for decoction.
    Another prescription for treating sores caused by prolonged sitting:
    Ginseng, platycodon, bitter orange, licorice, bupleurum, ligusticum, notopterygium, angelica, fangfeng, white atractylodes, peony, honeysuckle; crush and mix, add three slices of ginger and one jujube, decoct and take. Another prescription [from "Thousand Golden Prescriptions"]:
    For the treatment of five hemorrhoids, which many doctors cannot cure:
    Qinjiao, angelica, magnolia bark, stone heather, purple ginseng, chaotic hair, (upper and lower) worms, and purple aster, each one liang; two liang each of thunder pill and dried roots; half a jin each of guanzhong and (curled) worms; fourteen pig hind hooves.

    Detox Drink for Penile Ulcers
    Licorice, Fritillaria, Red Peony, Angelica, White Atractylodes, Qing Pi, Akebia, Lianqiao, Peach Kernel, Honeysuckle, and Tianhua Fen each one qian. Add Pangolin shell. If toxic gas wants to leak, add wine and steam Da Huang (rhubarb) three to four qian, then decoct and take. Drink alcohol as needed to enhance the effect. After taking the medicine, there will be more than ten bowel movements; the toxin turns into pus and blood, expelled through the stool.

    Another Recipe for Welting (Hiding and Lower Worms)
    Huanglian and fresh ginger each ten liang, Mugwort leaves eight liang, and bitter sophora four liang. The above four ingredients should be chewed and boiled in one dou of water to yield three sheng. Divide into three doses, and for severe cases, take three doses.

    Another Recipe for Concealed Worms
    Ejiao, Angelica, and Qing Sang Zi each two liang, a handful of Mugwort leaves. The above four ingredients should be chewed and boiled in eight sheng of water to yield two and a half sheng. Remove residue and divide into three doses.

    Another Recipe for Wet Diseases
    Xionghuang and Soap Pods each one fen, Musk and Vermilion each two fen. Grind the above four into powder, mix with honey and pound until thoroughly combined. For initial illness, take one pill the size of a walnut with wine two times a day. If there are ulcers in the lower part, take a powder the size of a walnut and apply it internally in the lower area, two times a day.[105p]

    　　痔漏方
    　　野葛　芍药　薤白　当归　通草各二分　附子一分　　右六味，(口父)咀，酢浸半日，先煎猪脂八合，令烟出，内乱发一分，令消尽下之。待冷，又内松脂八分、蜡二分，更着火上，和次内诸药煎，令沸三上三下，去滓，以故帛敷药贴肿上，干即易。如春月去附子，其发须尽洗去垢，不尔，令疮痛。[106p]

    Prescription for Dampness
    Take one tael each of indigo, coptis, yellow bracken, and clove, and two fen of musk. For the five ingredients, mix them and treat the lower part of the body with them, using large jujubes once a day. In more severe cases, take large jujubes, mix with two to three cups of sheep fat, and administer twice a day.

    Prescription for Hemorrhoids
    Take two fen each of wild kudzu, peony, garlic chives, angelica, and hempvine, and one fen of aconite. For the six ingredients, chew them and soak in vinegar for half a day. First, prepare eight portions of pig fat until smoke arises, then add one fen of the mixed herbs and allow it to fully dissolve. After it cools, add eight portions of pine resin and two fen of candle wax, ignite them, and mix with the other herbs to boil three times and strain. Use a piece of fine cloth to apply the medicine on the swelling, changing it once dry. In spring, remove the aconite to thoroughly clean it; otherwise, it will cause pain in the wound.[106p]

    　　蜀葵子半两　蝉蜕五个　槟榔一个，并为末　　右用枣三枚，取肉研细，搜和药末，如觉硬，滴少蜜，研成膏，量大小贴于病处。　　又方　治痔漏，因大肠感风热而生。　　生白砒　腻粉各一字　水银一粒，如米大　麝香一粒，如小豆大　　右件并入乳钵内研极细，如病有珠子者，将矾汤净洗拭干，用手捻药，揩在痔上，觉痒，便是药行。一日二次。又洗。五日后，住药见效。如或有孔，只用纸捻引药送之，令彻其内，更纸贴孔前，一日二次。[107p]

    Rectal Hemorrhoid Pain Formula

    One ounce of bitter orange peel, fry with aged rice until yellow, discard the rice. One part of green wood fragrance. Grind the above into powder; take two qian each time, mixed with food or drink.

    Another Formula for treating internal hemorrhoids with mouse milk and bleeding:
    White aster, root of mulberry tree, wolf's teeth root, burnt hedgehog skin, and equal parts of guan zhong and arsenic (half an ounce each). One head of white eel, burnt. One part of white skin from the eastern root of the locust tree, finely ground. Mix with pig fat from the twelfth month and form into a ball size of a marble, wrap in cotton and insert into the lower part.

    Washing Method
    Tianxianzi (celestial fairy), jingjie spike, small pepper, and viburnum berries. Boil in water and use for fumigation and washing.

    Application for Hemorrhoids
    Half an ounce of hibiscus seeds, five pieces of cicada slough, one betel nut, all ground into powder. Use three jujubes, remove the flesh and grind finely, then mix with the powdered medicine. If it feels stiff, add a little honey to make a paste, and apply to the affected area as needed.

    Another Formula for treating hemorrhoid leaks caused by wind-heat afflicting the large intestine:
    One character each of white arsenic and greasy powder, one grain of mercury about the size of a rice grain, one grain of musk about the size of a small bean. Grind these fine in a mortar; if there are any beads (hemorrhoids), wash them with alum water, dry, then pinch the medicine and apply to the hemorrhoids, feeling itchy means the medicine is working. Do this twice a day, followed by washing. After five days, the symptoms should improve. If there is a hole, use paper twisted to deliver the medicine inside, ensuring it clears internally, then apply paper to cover the hole, twice a day.[107p]

    Bitter Bark Pills: Treats toxic hemorrhoids and bleeding that does not stop.

    Prepare one pound of fresh Huangbopin, divided into four parts: one part soaked in wine for seven days, then washed and dried; one part soaked in vinegar for seven days, then washed and dried; one part soaked in child's urine for seven days, then washed and dried; one part stir-fried until black. Grind these into a powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of a walnut. Take fifty pills with warm wine on an empty stomach. Long-term use will eliminate the root cause.

    Warm White Pills (from "Rumen Shiqin"): Treats toxic bleeding.

    Remove the coarse skin from the root of the Chinese ash trees, soak it in wine, and dry. Grind into a powder, mix with jujube flesh to form pills the size of a walnut. Take fifty pills with weak wine or use the pills in a wine paste.

    Wash for Hemorrhoids and Fistula:

    Use Sichuan pepper, mugwort leaves, green onions, gallnut, potassium nitrate, horseweed, and eggplant root. Grind these into a powder, boil in water, first steam to fumigate, then wash it on-site. Pain will stop immediately, and healing is expected in a few days.

    Cooling Blood and Clearing Intestines Decoction (from "Zhengzhi Zhunsun", same below): Treats bleeding and prolapse of the rectum.

    Use each of the following: 1.2 grams of raw Rehmannia, Angelica, and Peony; 1 gram each of Saposhnikovia, Cimicifuga, and Schizonepeta; 0.5 grams each of fried Scutellaria, Coptis, and Cyperus; and 0.5 grams of Chuanxiong and Licorice. Boil in water to consume.[108p]

    Shen Zhu Shi Pi Decoction: Treats qi deficiency and prolapsed rectum.
    Ingredients: 2 qian of white atractylodes (washed and dry-fried), 2 qian of ginseng, 1.5 qian of meat fruit husk wrapped and stewed, 1 qian of white poria, 1 qian of white peony (dry-fried), 1 qian of dried tangerine peel, 0.8 qian of processed aconite, 0.7 qian of honey-fried licorice.
    Preparation: Use 2 sheng of water, add 3 slices of fresh ginger and 2 jujubes, decoct to 1 sheng and take. If prolapse is severe, add ascension hemp.

    Shen Zhu Qiong Gui Decoction: Treats diarrhea, dysentery, childbirth-related issues, qi deficiency, and prolapsed rectum, with threads of pulse.
    Ingredients: 1 qian each of ginseng, white atractylodes, chuanxiong, angelica, ascendant hemp, white poria, chinese yam, honey-fried astragalus, and dry-fried white peony; 0.5 qian of honey-fried licorice.
    Preparation: Add fresh ginger, decoct with water and take.

    He Zi Ren Shen Decoction: Treats previous conditions.
    Ingredients: He zi (Indian gooseberry) dried and pitted, ginseng, white poria, white atractylodes, honey-fried licorice, lotus seeds, ascendant hemp, and bupleurum, all in equal parts.
    Preparation: Add fresh ginger, decoct with water and take.

    Suo Sha San: Treats deficiency of the large intestine with heat, and prolapsed rectum with redness and swelling.
    Ingredients: Equal parts of suojin (cardamom), coptis, and horsetail.
    Preparation: Grind into fine powder, take 2 qian mixed with hollow rice drink.

    Huai Hua San: Treats blood in stool and prolapsed rectum.
    Preparation: Grind into powder, mix with sheep's blood, heat it, take with wine. "Bai Yi Xuan Fang" mentions that pig kidneys, peeled and boiled, can also be used. "Gu Jin Yi Jian" recommends mixing sheep's blood with the two powders, forming into blocks and drying, taking care to avoid cooking the blood, and taking 2 qian with yellow wine, named "Er Huai Dan."[109p]

    　　寸金锭子 【《东垣十书》】 　治前证。　　牡蛎粉　红藤根　干漆各五钱　藤黄　雄黄　雌黄　舶硫黄　轻粉　粉霜　麝香　砒霜　枯黄丹各一钱　　右为末，陈米饭和捣丸如枣核大，每一丸，纳肛门深二寸，用新砖球子二个，炭火烧赤，淬酢中，绵裹一个于肛门，熨之，冷即换之，下恶物，除根。[111p]

    The text provides medicinal preparations for treating different types of prolapse, specifically rectal prolapse, with detailed instructions for creating and applying the remedies.

    1. Pan Long San treats yang-type prolapse.

      • Ingredients include one tael of earth dragon, two taels of wind-processed nitrate.
      • Use one or two qian of the powder, applying it based on whether the anus is wet or dry, and prepare a wash with various herbs before applying the medicine.

    2. Fu Long Gan San treats yin-type prolapse.

      • Ingredients consist of one tael of Fu Long Gan, five qian of turtle shell, and two and a half qian of a decoction of various herbs.
      • Similar to the first remedy, it uses a strong decoction of purple perilla for washing and applying the mixture.

    3. Ci Shi San treats prolapse.

      • Contains half a tael of magnetite that has been calcined and treated with vinegar seven times.
      • The powdered remedy is to be taken one qian mixed with a hollow rice drink.

    4. Cun Jin Ding Zi treats anterior symptoms.

      • A combination of oyster powder, red vine root, and dry lacquer, each five qian; with one qian each of other ingredients including yellow substances and musk.
      • The mixture is formed into small pills, which should be inserted into the anus deeply and heated with red-hot bricks. This procedure is repeated until the undesirable matter is expelled.

    These remedies emphasize various herbal ingredients and methods of application, focusing on the condition's specific types and symptoms.[111p]

    　　参芪汤 【《万病回春》】 　一名提肛散，治肛门虚寒脱出。　　人参　黄芪蜜炒　当归　白朮　生地黄　白芍药酒炒　白茯苓各一钱　升麻　桔梗　陈皮　干姜炒，各五分　甘草炙，三分　　右銼，作一贴，水煎服。

    　　熏鳖法 【《古今医鉴》】 　治痔漏脱肛。　　鳖一个放坛内　麝香三分
    　　右将滚水倾入坛内泡鳖，坐其上熏之，良久，将水洗痔后，将肉作羹食之，将鳖头作末掺肛上。
    　　独虎散 【《直指方》】 　治脱肛。　　五倍子半两
    　　右水三碗，煎至碗半，入焰硝、荆芥各一钱，乘热熏洗，用五倍子末掺之。
    　　文蛤散 【《得效方》】 　治脱肛不收。　　五倍子末　白矾　蛇床子
    　　右煎汤熏洗，后以赤石脂末掺芭蕉叶上托入。或长尺余者，以两床相接，中空，以器盛药水满，架起与床平，令病者仰卧浸器中，逐日如此，缩尽为度。[112p]

    Shengqi Decoction (from "Wanbing Huichun"): Also known as Ti Gang San, it treats the virtual cold prolapse of the anus. Ingredients: 1 qian each of ginseng, honey-fried astragalus, angelica, white atractylodes, raw rehmannia, wine-fried white peony, white poria; 5 fen each of cimicifuga, balloon flower, dried tangerine peel, and fried ginger; and 3 fen of honey-fried licorice. Grind the above into a powder, make into a paste, and decoct in water for oral consumption.

    Fumigating Soft-Shelled Turtle Method (from "Gujin Yijian"): Treats hemorrhoids and anal prolapse. Take one soft-shelled turtle and place it in a jar with 3 fen of musk. Pour boiling water into the jar to soak the turtle and sit over it for fumigation for a long time. Afterward, wash the hemorrhoids with the water and consume the meat as a soup; grind the turtle's head into a powder to mix with the anus.

    Duhu Powder (from "Zhizhi Fang"): Treats anal prolapse. Use 5 liang of gallnut. Take 3 bowls of water and decoct until reduced to half a bowl, then add 1 qian each of natron and schizonepeta. Fumigate and wash with this concoction, then mix gallnut powder in.

    Wenhe Powder (from "Dexiaofang"): Treats anal prolapse that does not retract. Ingredients: gallnut powder, white alum, and cnidium. Decoct in water for fumigation and washing, then apply a mixture of red rock resin powder with banana leaves to support and insert. For those with over a foot in length, connect two beds together with a hollow space in the middle, place a vessel filled with medicinal water on the frame level with the bed to allow the patient to lie back and soak in the vessel. Repeat daily until retraction is achieved.[112p]

    　　浮萍散　治脱肛。
    　　秋暮，取霜露浸过浮萍，不拘多少，以净瓦摊开阴干。其瓦一日一易，不可见日，务要阴干，用纸包起。　　右研为细末，先以井水洗净肛门，后以药末掺上，其肛徐徐即入。
    　　孩儿散 【《医学入门》，下同】 　治肛脱热肿。　　熊胆五分　孩儿茶二分　片脑一分
    　　右为末，人乳调敷肛上，热汁自出而肛收。

    Floating duckweed disperses; it treats anal prolapse.

    In late autumn, take frost and dew to soak the duckweed, regardless of the amount, then spread it out on a clean tile to dry in the shade. Replace the tile daily, avoiding sunlight, ensuring it is dried in the shade. Wrap it in paper.

    Grind it into a fine powder. First, wash the anal area with well water, then apply the powdered medicine, allowing it to gradually enter the anus.

    Child’s Powder: Treats anal prolapse with heat swelling.

    Bear bile: 5 parts
    Child's tea: 2 parts
    Bitter almond: 1 part

    Grind these together. Mix with breast milk and apply to the anus; warm juice will seep out, causing retraction of the anus.

    Poria powder: Treats anal prolapse.

    White poria and peeled hemp seeds are to be ground together and blended, steamed and dried nine times, then mixed with a little honey. Regular consumption can help abstain from alcohol, meat, salt, and sauces, and can treat chronic hemorrhoids.

    Seven Holy Pills: Treats unbearable anal pain. The pulse diagnosis states: Accumulated gas arises beside the spleen, causing intense abdominal pain. This medicine addresses it.

    Ingredients:
    (Fragrant) Li Ren: 1 tael 5 qian
    Qiang Huo: 1 tael
    Stewed Da Huang: 8 qian
    Betel nut, cinnamon, aromatic wood, and Chuan Xiong: each 5 qian

    Grind into powder, form pills the size of a jujube, and take 30 to 50 pills with warm water. A slight benefit will lead to recovery; do not seek quick relief, as this can aggravate hemorrhoids.[113p]

    Huai Jiao Wan: Treats hemorrhoids and anal prolapse with swelling and pain, or bleeding during bowel movements.

    Shuang Jie San: Treats male sexual disorders, strengthens vital essence, leading to mingling of essence and blood, causing swelling and pain at the anus, with difficulty in urination and defecation.

    Wind-Dissipating and Moisturizing Decoction: Treats hemorrhoids that cause swelling and pain, as well as constipation. Ingredients: 1.5 grams each of Feng (Siler), Jing Jie Su (Schizonepeta), Qiang Huo (Notopterygium), Huang Lian (Coptis), Huang Qin (Scutellaria), Qin Jiao (Gentiana), and Zhi Ke (Bitter Orange); 3 grams each of Ze Xie (Alisma) and peeled and charred soap nut; 3 grams of peeled and ground peach kernels; and 3 grams of Hong Hua (Carthamus tinctorius). Add 6 grams of Da Huang (Rhubarb) and prepare a dose using two bowls of water, boiling down to one-eighth. Administer before meals.

    Hemorrhoid Ointment [from the "Medical Essentials"]: Treats external hemorrhoids, prolapsed hemorrhoids, and pain with pus and continuous discharge. Ingredients: Two bowls of concentrated juice from filtered ash, boiled down to one bowl. Add 6 grams each of prepared Chuan Wu (Aconitum) and Da Huang (Rhubarb), simmer on low heat until reduced to half a bowl. Add 3 grams of Gan Cao (Licorice), boil briefly, then stir in half a spoon of fine lime powder, rolling three to five times. Filter through two layers of silk, then continue simmering until it becomes an ointment. Once cooled, add 2.5 grams of refined alum, ground very finely. Store in a ceramic container. When using, mix in a small amount of dragon brain powder and apply with a silver probe, once a day or three to five times for severe cases. First wash the area with the medicinal liquid before applying; the results are remarkable.[115p]

    　　秦艽苍朮汤 【《东垣十书》，下同】 　治前证。　　秦艽　桃仁去皮尖，另研　防风　苍朮制　皂角仁烧存性为末，各一钱半　当归梢酒洗　泽泻各一钱　大黄少许，虽大便过濇，亦不宜多用　黄蘗酒洗各五分，若大肠头沉重者，湿胜也，更加之。如天气大热，或病人燥热喜冷，以意加之　　右除桃仁、皂角仁二味外，余药(口父)咀如麻豆大，都作一服，水三盏，煎一盏二分，去滓入桃仁等二味，再上火，煎至一盏，空心候宿食消尽，热服之，待少时，以美膳压之，不犯胃也。服药日，忌生冷硬物冷菜之类及酒湿面大料物干姜之类，犯之其药无效。如有白脓加白葵花五朵去萼，青皮半钱去白，入正药中同煎；又用木香三分为细末，同桃仁等二味，再上火同煎，依上法服饵。古人治此疾，多以岁月除之，此药一服立愈。病大者，再服而愈。[116p]

    Qin Jiao Cang Zhu Decoction

    For treating prior evidence.

    Qin Jiao, peach kernels peeled and pointed, ground separately; Fang Feng; Cang Zhu prepared; and soapberry seeds burnt to retain their properties, each one and a half qian.

    Dong Quai tops cleaned with wine, and Ze Xie, each one qian; a slight amount of Da Huang, even if the stool is too thin, it should not be used excessively.

    Huang Lian cleaned with wine, each five fen. If there is heaviness in the large intestine, it indicates excess dampness, increase accordingly.

    If the weather is extremely hot, or if the patient has a dry heat and prefers coolness, add accordingly.

    Excluding the peach kernels and soapberry seeds, the remaining medicines (mouth father) should be chewed to the size of a large mung bean and combined into one dose; use three sheng of water, boil down to one sheng and two fen, dispose of the residue and add in the peach kernels and the two other ingredients, then reheat and boil down to one sheng.

    Take on an empty stomach and wait for undigested food to pass, take while hot, and afterwards, have a light meal that does not irritate the stomach.

    On the day of taking the medicine, avoid raw, cold, hard food, raw vegetables, wine, damp flour, and spicy ginger, as these will counteract the effects of the medicine.

    If there is white pus, add five blossoms of white sunflower without sepals, and half a qian of Qing Pi, discarding the white, add to the main medicine and boil together.

    Also use three fen of Mu Xiang finely powdered, combined with the peach kernels and two other ingredients, then reheat and boil again, following the previous method to take the medicine.

    Ancient practitioners often treated this disease with time; this medicine can bring immediate recovery after one dose. For severe cases, take again to be cured.[116p]

    Kefen San: For treating hemorrhoids with persistent bleeding, sores, and swelling.     1. Gan Ge Decoction:
      Mix and prepare the following: 1.5 grams of dried tangerine peel, stir-fried bitter orange peel, banxia (pinellia), ginger, raw rehmannia, poria, and apricot kernels; 0.5 grams of Chinese skullcap and honey-fried licorice. Add two cups of water, 100 black beans, five slices of ginger, and one white plum, and decoct until reduced to one cup. Take before meals.

    2. Tangerine Peel Soup:
      Treats the previous symptoms. Use: 1.5 grams each of tangerine peel, stir-fried bitter orange peel, stir-fried sophora flower, and Chuanxiong; 1 gram each of peeled and roasted peach kernel, houttuynia, betel nut, perilla, cyperus, and honey-fried licorice. Grind, add two cups of water, three slices of ginger, and two red dates, then decoct to one cup. Warm and take before meals.

    3. Weilingxian Pill:
      Treats qi hemorrhoids and constipation. Use: 50 grams each of weilingxian (clematis), frankincense (ground separately), and stir-fried bitter orange peel. Grind into fine powder, mix with millet rice to make pills the size of a tung seed. Take 15 pills before meals with rice drink, three times a day.

    4. Xun Yan Formula:
      Treats qi hemorrhoids and rectal prolapse. Use: 50 grams each of stir-fried bitter orange peel and fangfeng (siler), 2.5 grams of burnt white alum (ground separately). Grind thoroughly, mix, and add three cups of water, decoct to two cups. While hot, use for fumigation, and also dip soft cloth in the liquid to apply warmth. Afterward, wash with the liquid.

    5. Mulberry Wood Ear Powder:
      Treats hemorrhoids and itching and pain around the anus. Use: 50 grams each of roasted mulberry wood ear and roasted sophora wood ear, roasted hedgehog skin, qianhu (notopterygium), and stir-fried angelica. Use 100 grams of stir-fried bitter orange peel. Grind into fine powder, take 6 grams before meals mixed with porridge drink.[121p]

    For treating hot toxicity in hemorrhoids.

    Smoke treatment for hemorrhoids and pain.
    White snake fish bones and mature mugwort, equal portions.
    Grind them finely and mix well, place in a new bowl, seal the mouth with paper, leaving an opening to release smoke. Light the medicine and let the smoke escape through the opening, sit above to be smoked until the smoke is exhausted, then stop.

    Black jade pill treats both new and long-standing intestinal wind hemorrhoids, particularly severe pain. Take this medicine, and after three to four doses, you will see the results. Initially, this ailment may present with itching or pain, with lumps forming around the anus — these are hemorrhoids. If they rupture, it leads to leakage; if there’s only bleeding, it’s intestinal wind. All these result from excess in wine, color, qi, food, and five other causes, leading to this illness. Many people rely on external physicians for treatment, or there may be worms eroding within the intestines. If one does not address the root cause, the ailment will not be cured; this medicine truly has miraculous effects.

    Ingredients include:
    Hedgehog skin, three taels; locust pods, three taels; forty-nine pieces of pig’s hind hoof; cow horn (horn thought), ground; tangled hair washed with soap pods; and spoiled palm fibers, each two taels. All six ingredients are placed into a pot and boiled to preserve their properties.

    Aside from these:
    Bitter neem bark, one tael and two and a half qian; black sesame seeds, one tael; thunder ball, one tael; frankincense, five qian; musk, one qian. Grind these into a powder. Use wine to cook a paste for pills the size of a tongzi (Chinese parasol seed). Take eight pills each time, first chewing a walnut, then swallow with warm wine or wine boiled with seaweed, on an empty stomach before meals, three times a day. Avoid other medicines, and within three to five days, completely eradicate the problem.[124p]

    　　乳香二钱　厚朴姜制　粉草炙　白朮　桂心　附子炮裂，米酢中浸，再炮三五次，去皮脐，各一两　木香二钱五分　　右为细末，炼蜜丸如桐子大，空心米饮下二三十丸。丹溪云：精要治漏诸疮，与桂附丸。此属冷，只因疮久不合，风冷乘之，血气不潮而成也。厚朴虽温，其泻卫尤速，恐不若参、芪佐以陈皮，庶乎与病情相得。此方治冷漏疮。若寒而虚者，只以加味十全汤，随时令经络加减用之为当。又虚甚者，宜参朮归芪膏。

    Two qian of frankincense, thick bark processed with ginger, powdered herbs roasted, white atractylodes, cassia heart, and processed aconite soaked in rice vinegar, re-roasted three to five times, with skins and navel removed, each one liang. Danxi states: The essence is to treat leaking sores, along with cassia aconite pills. This belongs to the cold category, as the sores have not healed for a long time, with wind and cold taking advantage, leading to stagnation of blood and qi, resulting in this condition. Although thick bark is warm, its purging of defensive qi is swift, which may not be as effective as ginseng and astragalus combined with aged tangerine peel, to align better with the illness. This formula treats cold leaking sores. If there is cold and deficiency, it is appropriate to use Enhanced Shiquan Decoction, adjusting according to seasonal meridians.     For the sinking pulse powder, it treats leaking sores and tumors lasting for twenty to thirty years, some as large as a cup, resulting in leaking and ulceration which depletes bone and flesh; they may be firm or soft or ulcerated, causing alarm and restlessness, with internal pulling pain that recurs after healing.

    Dried ginger processed, powdered amber, processed aconite with skins removed, rhubarb, each one liang; seven qian and five fen of salvia; powdered yellow sulfur; powdered white quartz; powdered bellflower; powdered fish bone, each half a liang.

    Grind the above into a powder, store in a ceramic box wrapped in cloth to prevent air leakage.     Centipede Oil

    To treat various hemorrhoids. On the Dragon Boat Festival, take one large centipede, dry it in the shade on a bamboo skewer. When ready, cut off an inch, burn it to retain its essence, and mix it with sesame oil for application. If the condition is mild, it will not flare up. If severe, it may recur the following year on the same date; then cut off another inch, burn it, and apply to sever the root. Another method involves using several live centipedes, soaking them in sesame oil, waiting for them to mold slightly, and applying to hemorrhoids and various sores.

    Dried Hemorrhoid Formula

    To reduce swelling of various hemorrhoids. Use equal parts realgar, sulfur, and alum. Grind into a powder, using a new dish: first layer half of the alum powder, then place the remaining medicines, and cover with alum powder. Calcine over fire until the alum is dried; grind into a powder, mix with saliva to apply until it dries and falls off. Finally, use gypsum and gallnut ground into powder to cover the wound for effective results.

    Black Spirit Powder

    To treat fistulas.

    Use one part oyster powder, one part genuine cinnabar, and one part sulfur, grind together. Add two parts powdered hornet's nest, fry until smoke dissipates, then grind into a fine powder. Add one part ash from burnt hair and a small amount of musk; mix evenly for application.

    The text describes various formulations and remedies for healing purposes.

    First, a fine powder is prepared, and a paper wick is dipped to apply it inside the wound, promoting natural flesh growth. Additionally, two qian (a unit of weight) of this powder can be mixed with rice wine and taken without time restrictions, showing effects in three days.

    Next, there is a prescription for a decoction of astragalus and wine to treat cold, heat, dampness, and painful hard swellings in the buttocks. The ingredients include two qian each of astragalus and salt water, one and a half qian of bupleurum, one qian each of forsythia and cinnamon, half a qian of licorice and huangbai, and seven fen of angelica. Additionally, one qian of fried big seed is included. This mixture is boiled with equal parts of water and wine, to be taken before meals.

    There is a remedy known as Shen Ying San for treating hemorrhoids, comprising one broken piece of yellow cow horn, seven pieces of pig's tooth soap pod without skin or strings, a piece of snake shed skin, seven pieces of pangolin scales, and an ounce of hedgehog skin. All ingredients are finely ground and combined in a jar with yellow clay. This is fired until red, allowed to cool, and then ground into a powder. Before sleeping, a walnut is chewed until it becomes a paste, followed by drinking a cup of good wine to induce sleep. At dawn, three qian of the herb powder should be taken with warm wine, followed by another dose at the third hour. Although the illness may be chronic, just three doses will yield immediate results.

    Lastly, there is a modified Xiang Su San, also known as Citrus Peel Decoction, to treat qi hemorrhoids. The ingredients are one qian each of dried tangerine peel, bitter orange peel, chuanxiong, and sophora flower, with five fen each of perilla stems and leaves, betel nut, wood fragrance, peach kernel, cyperus, and licorice. These are ground into a paste and cooked with three slices of ginger and two dates.[132p]

    The first prescription is a powder for treating unbearable pain from hemorrhoids. It consists of equal parts of blood resins, oyster powder, and ash. Grind it into a fine powder, add a small amount of musk, mix with saliva for application, or use almond paste for application.

    The second prescription is a pill for treating itching and pain from hemorrhoids. According to the "Inner Canon," all painful and itchy sores are related to heart fire, which is the source of these hemorrhoids. This medicine addresses that. It includes one tael of huanglian (coptis chinensis), five qian each of fu shen (poria), and chi fu ling (red poria). Grind it into a fine powder, form into pills the size of a seed, and take them with hollow rice drink, consuming a hundred pills.

    The third prescription is a powder for treating itchy pain from all types of hemorrhoids. It consists of one qian of desiccated alum and five fen of powdered cortex. Grind into a fine powder, wash first with medicated soup, and then apply a small amount.

    The final prescription, Shui Ma San, treats all hemorrhoids. In the summer's dog days, collect thirty water ants, known as "Shui Ma Er," which jump around on the water's surface. Bundle them with three pieces of paper, ten in each bundle, and hang them in a shaded place to dry. Each bundle constitutes one dose; grind to a paste and mix with warm wine for consumption. After a long time, eat a meal. Within three days, take three doses, and effects will be noticeable within ten days. For those suffering from chronic hemorrhoids with pus and blood, this will eliminate the root cause.[134p]

    　　莲花蕊散　治痔漏二三十年不愈者，三服效。　　莲花蕊　黑乌头末各一两五钱　当归五钱　矾红二钱　　右为末，先忌食肉六七日，空心食肉一顿，取温酒下药三钱，取下脓血或虫，是效。
    　　取漏脓法 【《医学入门》】 　治内痔久漏，取脓最妙。　　焰硝三两　苦参一两五钱[136p]

    To use the gall of three white roosters, extract the juice and mix it well. Use chicken feathers to apply it to the hemorrhoid area, first washing it with the solution to clean, then applying the medication for effective results.

    For the method to remove hemorrhoid worms: If there are worms in the hemorrhoids, resembling fine black threads, they should be removed entirely. Take half a sheng of Qumai (a herb) and a one-inch piece of pig's tooth soapwort. Grind these into a powder, add one pig kidney, and cook it with rice water. Consume on an empty stomach, and after a short while,腹痛 (abdominal pain) will occur, leading to a bowel movement where the worms will be expelled. Bury them in a pit and restore the body with a light porridge.

    For the Cooling Blood Decoction: To treat hemorrhoids caused by wind-heat dryness affecting the large intestine, the focus is on cooling the blood. Use one qian each of ginseng, astragalus, coptis, raw rehmannia, angelica, chuanxiong, sophora flower, scutellaria, bitter orange, and herba silenes. Grind these together to form a plaster, decoct in water, and take on an empty stomach or in pill form.

    Lotus Flower Pistil Powder: For hemorrhoids that haven't healed after two or three decades, three doses will be effective. Use one and a half liang each of lotus flower pistil and black aconite powder, five qian of angelica, and two qian of red alum. Grind these into a powder, avoiding meat for six or seven days, then consume meat one time on an empty stomach, taking three qian of the medicine with warm wine to expel pus, blood, or worms.

    Method for Treating Pus from an Internal Hemorrhoid: To address long-term leaking internal hemorrhoids, extracting the pus is most effective. Use three liang of potassium nitrate and one and a half liang of bitter sophora.[136p]

    　　右为末，用布四寸长，二寸阔，缝一袋，入药半袋，以砒三分放药末中间，方入全药。袋满缝袋中两头，安带子如跨马系住。
    　　活龟丸　治肠风痔漏。
    　　大乌龟一个，以火烧地热，盖龟于地，逼出臭屁尽，通身用草包缚，外用黄泥固济，灰火煨熟，取肉研泥　龟壳用牛骨髓涂炙五七次，透心酥干为末黄连一两，九蒸九晒　当归尾三钱三分　　右共为末，和龟肉捣丸梧子大，白汤下五七十丸。
    　　豚胃丸　治痔漏。亦治诸瘘。

    　　辰砂膏 【《丹溪心法》】 　痔漏塞窍。　　信砒一钱　白矾二钱　密陀僧　辰砂各五钱　　右，先研信砒细，铺锅底，次用矾末铺砒上，火煅烟尽为度；次将陀僧、辰砂研细，白糕和匀，作尖挺如小麦大，取一粒纳漏孔内，俟败肉尽后，贴生肌散。[137p]

    The following is the translated text:

    The above is the end recipe. Use a cloth that is four inches long and two inches wide to sew a bag. Fill half of the bag with medicine, and place three grams of arsenic in the middle of the medicine before adding the remaining medicine. Once the bag is full, sew both ends and attach a strap as if to secure it for riding a horse.

    Living Turtle Pill: Treats intestinal wind and hemorrhoids.

    Take one large turtle, burn it on the ground with heat, cover the turtle with soil to force out the foul gas completely. Bind the turtle with grass all over and apply yellow clay for firmness. Cook it with ash until it is well done, then remove the meat and grind it into a paste. Coat the turtle shell with beef marrow and roast it five to seven times until it is fully dried and reduced to powder.

    One ounce of Huanglian (Coptis chinensis) with nine steams and nine sun-dryings; three qian and three fen of Angelica tail.

    Combine these into a powder and mix them with the turtle meat to form pills the size of a jujube. Take five to seventy pills with white soup.

    Pig Stomach Pill: Treats hemorrhoids and various fistulas.

    Two ounces of Sophora flower, one ounce each of Huanglian, and peony root; seven qian of hedgehog skin and six qian of Radix Notopterygii.

    Grind these ingredients, place them inside the pig's stomach, sew it shut, and boil it until tender. Remove the medicine and eat the stomach. If it is hard, take more until the affected area softens. You may also form pills with the above medicines and consume them.

    Cinnabar Ointment [from "Danxi's Heart Method"]: Treats hemorrhoids and blockages.

    One qian of genuine arsenic, two qian of alum, and five qian each of myrrh and cinnabar.

    First, grind the genuine arsenic finely and spread it on the bottom of a pot. Next, sprinkle alum powder over the arsenic, then heat it until the smoke disappears. Subsequently, grind myrrh and cinnabar finely, mix with white cake evenly, and form into small, pointed pills the size of wheat. Take one pill and insert it into the fistula. After the rotten flesh has been expelled, apply a fresh tissue powder.[137p]

    　　田螺膏　治痔疮肿痛，坐卧不得，诸药不效者。　　大田螺八九个，以针挑开顶盖，入白矾末少许于内，置地上，尖底埋土中，其顶盖仰天，经一宿，次日取盖上水汁，以鸡羽涂痔上五七次，即消。

    Snail Paste: Treats the swelling and pain of hemorrhoids, when sitting or lying down is unbearable, and other medicines are ineffective. Take eight or nine large snails, use a needle to puncture the top cover, place a small amount of alum powder inside, bury the pointed end in the ground, and let the top cover face the sky overnight. The next day, take the water that collects on the lid and apply it to the hemorrhoids five to seven times, and it will reduce.

    Methods for Treating Hemorrhoids:

    1. Prolapsed Rectum: Use black dragon tail and mouse droppings, burn them in a container, and sit over it to be enveloped in the smoke several times, and it will no longer prolapse. (Black dragon tail refers to dust from rafters.)

    2. Wind Heat Prolapse: Pound iron powder together with white straw flour and apply it while pressing it in.

    3. Cold Deficiency Prolapse: Heat lime and wrap it in cloth to sit on. Change the cloth when it cools.

    4. Prolapsed Rectum: Use half a tael of magnetic stone, fire and calcine it with vinegar seven times to make a powder; take one qian with hollow rice for drinking.

    Treatment for Hemorrhoids:
    For mild cases, use a decoction of east-facing purslane and Liu Jinu's herbs for steaming. Once it cools, wash and dry with hands. For severe cases, add half of the dry stems of big green leaves to the decoction.

    Itching Hemorrhoids: Use a strong decoction of grey amaranth root, first for steaming, then for washing. Another method: wash frequently with river water and apply snail secretion.

    One Method for Treating Hemorrhoids: Use pieces of male chicken gallbladder, mix evenly and apply.

    Unbearable Pain from Hemorrhoids: Use the roots of Goji berries, pound them until crushed, and apply a steaming wash; the pain will stop immediately.

Make pill-sized balls each day, insert into the anus, and discard with the next bowel movement. Internally take a pill made of black plum and yellow bitter herb.

    Swollen and Painful Ulcers: Use seven pig gallbladders and ten cotton-candy flowers, mix with clear water and apply seven times.[175p]

    　　　　针灸

    　　《灵枢》曰：热病头痛颞颥，目瘈脉痛善衄，厥热病也，取之以第三针，视有余不足，寒热痔。　　《甲乙经》曰：痔痛，攒竹主之。
    　　痔，会阴主之。凡痔与阴相通者死。阴中诸病，前后相引痛，不得大小便，皆主之。　　痔骨蚀，商丘主之。

    　　痔篡痛，承筋主之。[176p]

    　　脱肛下利，气街主之。
    　　《千金方》曰：飞扬，主痔篡伤痛。　　绝骨，主瘘马刀腋肿。
    　　天突、章门、天池、支沟，主漏。
    　　商丘、复溜，主痔血泄后重。
    　　劳宫，主热痔。

    　　五痔便血，失屎，灸回气百壮。穴在脊穷骨上。　　病寒冷脱肛出，灸脐中，随年壮。
    　　脱肛历年不愈，灸横骨百壮，又灸龟尾七壮。龟尾即后穷骨是也。　　《疮疡全书》曰：脏毒初起微肿，即用湿蚯蚓粪，捻成饼如钱厚，放患上，艾壮如半粒豆大者，烧之微热，即去，再换饼烧之，再易如前法，以十四壮为期，外用冰香散擦之。　　虚人脱肛。夫冬至前天道严寒，其气极沉极降之际，况人身小天地，天在上，人居中，地居下，岂不相应乎？治之不能即奏功也。阳生后日长一线，阳渐长，阴渐消矣。宜用灸法治之，无不效者。病人亦要戒气少劳为上策。[177p]

    For those with a deficiency, prolapse can occur. Indeed, before the winter solstice, the heavenly forces are extremely cold and heavy, corresponding with the human body, which is a small cosmos: heaven above, humans in the middle, and earth below. Should not the effects be congruent? Treatment may not yield immediate results. As Yang increases after the solstice, and daytime lengthens, Yang gradually grows and Yin diminishes. Moxibustion should be used as treatment; it will be effective for all. Patients should also avoid excessive labor and maintain a calm disposition for the best results.[177p]

    择晴明和暖吉日，在不通风净暖室中坐卧，取顶上旋毛中百会穴，以酱一匕擦上，艾灸三壮，随服升元大补汤，其肛渐收矣。盖百会为一身之枢纽，大能升提下陷之气，故能奏功。若冬至前不可灸，灸之何益？次日再灸尾骶骨，又灸脐中，随年壮。此法余用之甚效，诸痔漏亦治之。　　丹溪心法》曰：凡痔疮先取头垢，捏成饼子，安痔头上，其上又安大蒜一片，以艾灸之。　　又痔痛：以附子末津唾和作饼子如钱大，安漏上，以艾灸令微热，干则易以新饼再灸，明日又灸，直至肉平为效。[178p]

    Select a clear and warm auspicious day, sit or lie in a well-ventilated and warm room. Do not perform moxibustion before the Winter Solstice, as it would be of no benefit. The next day, apply moxibustion on the coccyx and around the navel, adjusting according to the year's vigor. This method has proven very effective for me, and it also treats various forms of hemorrhoids.

    　　《医学纲目》曰：脱肛，取大肠俞百会、长强、肩井、合谷、气冲。　　针灸痔，独取足太阳。经云：足太阳之脉所生病者，痔，疟，视盛虚热寒陷下取之。盖后世取承山穴者是也。其二论督脉而不见其取法。经云：督脉生病，癃痔。盖后世取长强穴是也。　　痔漏下血，里急后重，或痒或疼。二白在掌后横纹上四寸，手厥阴脉，两穴相并，一穴在两筋中，一穴在大筋外，针入三分，泻两吸。又法：大痛方，取长强一寸到穴，泻三吸，如灸可七壮，虽久不愈者亦效。[179p]

    The "Medical Guidelines" states: For rectal prolapse, select points from the large intestine meridian: Baihui, Changqiang, Jianjing, Hegu, and Qichong.

    For acupuncture in cases of hemorrhoids, focus solely on the foot Taiyang meridian. The classic mentions: diseases arising from the foot Taiyang meridian include hemorrhoids, malaria, and conditions of excess or deficiency, heat or cold, which descend. This is why later generations also selected the Chengshan point.

    There are also discussions on the Du meridian, although its treatment methods are not mentioned. The classic states: diseases arising from the Du meridian can include urinary retention and hemorrhoids. Hence, later generations selected the Changqiang point as well.

    In cases of hemorrhoids with anal bleeding, urgency, heaviness, or either itching or pain, locate Erbai four inches above the transverse crease on the palm along the hand Jueyin meridian. One point is positioned between two tendons and the other outside the larger tendon; insert the needle three-tenths of an inch, with two calming and three invigorating techniques.

    Another method for significant pain: apply the needle at Changqiang one inch deep to the acupoint, with a cycle of three calming and three invigorating techniques.     　　又法：取承山二寸半，补一呼，如灸可七壮。　　《古今医统》曰：命门一穴，在脊中，与脐相对，灸七壮，治五种痔病。　　又法，长强一穴，在尾骶上，随年壮灸之，治五痔便血最效。　　又法：治痔病大如黄瓜，贯于肠头，发则僵仆，以荆芥汤洗之，次以艾灸其上三五壮，若觉一道热气入肠中，大泻鲜红血秽，一时许痛后，其疾乃愈。　　又法：治痔初起，痛痒不止，以旧布鞋底烘热，痛痒处频频熨之。冷则再烘熨，其痛痒立止。　　脱肛：灸长强穴三壮，愈；脐中，随年壮。百会一穴在顶中，灸三壮，治小儿脱肛。[180p]

    　　　　导引

    　　《古今医统》曰：痔漏乃气血下坠，冲突为痔，既不能坐，又不能行立，惟导引之法可愈矣。其法高枕偃卧，息心调气，气定，其肿自收。　　又法：两手抱足，头不动，足向口受气，众节气散来去三七，欲得捉，左右侧身各急挽腰不动，去四肢腰上下气血凝滞，髓内冷血冷，筋急痔漏肿痛。　　又法：两足相蹈，向阴踹急蹙，将两手捧膝头，两向急势捧之二七竟，身侧两向取势二七，前后努腰七，去心劳痔病。　　又法：踞坐合两膝，张两足，不息两通，治五痔。　　又法：一足蹈地，一足屈膝，两手抱犊鼻下，急挽向身极势，左右换易四七。去痔五劳，三里气不下。[181p]

    Guide to Healing

    The "Ancient and Modern Medical Treatise" states: Hemorrhoids occur due to a downward fall of qi and blood, leading to conflicts that cause hemorrhoids. This condition prevents one from sitting or standing, but can be cured by the method of guided movement. The approach is to lie with the head elevated, calm the heart, and regulate the qi; when the qi stabilizes, the swelling will naturally recede.

    Another method involves: embracing the feet with both hands, keeping the head still while the feet receive qi towards the mouth, causing the energy at various joints to disperse. One should try to grasp the energy while turning the body sideways, applying pressure on the waist, without moving the limbs. This can alleviate the stagnation of qi and blood in the lower body, relieving the cold blood inside the marrow and the tension that leads to hemorrhoidal swelling and pain.

    Additionally, there is a method: with the feet together, pressing and kicking towards the lower body, using both hands to hold the knees. Apply pressure quickly and effectively in both directions, followed by moving the waist forward and backward to relieve the stress on the heart and treat hemorrhoids.

    Another approach involves: sitting with knees together and spreading the feet, maintaining the breathing open, which treats five types of hemorrhoids.

    Another technique: with one foot on the ground and the other bent at the knee, holding onto the lower legs with both hands and applying strong pressure towards the body, alternating sides four times. This helps alleviate hemorrhoids and relieves the burden on the lower qi.[181p]

    　　《保生秘要》曰：痔疮导引法，于尾闾骶骨间长强穴上，掏六十四度，擦亦如数，兼用吸提呵法，自尔安乐。　　运功：坐定息均，注念存疮，吸提四浊九口，再凝艮背法运尾闾，运疮百遍，复升腰俞运二七数，逐日行功不间，自去患根。　　痔漏导引法：依患处念推而散之，复两手抱两膝吹而吸之。　　又法：吹而散之各六遍，旋转其皮肤患处，想火烧之，次升涌泉水入肺经，推而散之。　　艮背法：静坐片时，将万虑扫除，凝神定志于本穴之中，背之腔子里，平心元虚处，初从口念太乙救苦，而渐归于心，归于背，存无守有，念兹在兹，有复冥于无，神自虚而灵矣。[182p]

    The "Secret Essentials of Preserving Life" states: The method for guiding hemorrhoids involves the area between the coccyx and sacrum, specifically at the Changqiang point. Dig at a 64-degree angle and rub as needed, while also employing the suction and exhaling technique for self-comfort.

    Movement exercise: Sit down with regular breathing, focus your thoughts on the afflicted area, inhale the four turbidities through nine orifices, then consolidate the energy and direct it to the coccyx, performing this for a hundred repetitions. After that, elevate the energy through the waist and perform the exercise in a count of twenty-seven; engage in daily practice without interruption to naturally eliminate the root of the problem.

    For the guiding method for anal seepage: Visualize the afflicted area and disperse the energy, then use both hands to embrace both knees, inhaling and exhaling.

    Another method: disperse the energy through blowing six times, rotating the skin around the afflicted area, imagining a fiery burn, and then allow the spring water to rise and flow into the lung meridian, dispersing the energy.

    Back consolidation method: Sit quietly for a while, clear your mind of all thoughts, focus your spirit and determination on the main point, within the cavity of the back, in a tranquil and empty state. Initially, recite "Taiyi saves the distressed" from your mouth, gradually returning the focus to your heart and back, maintaining awareness of both the void and the existence, lingering in the present, and fusing hidden with the non-existent; the spirit becomes empty and thus is able to resonate.[182p]

    　　　　医案

    　　《疮疡全书》曰：一人患痔，每日食海螺蛳半升，因咸，以苦茶漱口，纳及一斗，又能清心寡欲，痔即消矣。痔乃脏火属阳，海螺蛳乃性寒味咸属阴，寒能敌火，咸能软坚，茶又苦凉之味，殆有理也。
    　　《儒门事亲》曰：赵君玉常病痔，凤眼草、刺猬皮、槐根、狸首之类皆用之。或以干姜作末，涂猪肉炙食之，大便燥结，不利且肿。后数日，因病黄。予治令大涌泻数次，不言痔作，麻先生偶记而书之。君玉自识戴人之后，痔更不发耳。[183p]

    Medical Case

    The "Complete Book on Sores" states: A person suffered from hemorrhoids and consumed half a liter of sea snails daily. Due to their salty nature, he rinsed his mouth with bitter tea and consumed up to a dou (approximately 10 liters). He was also able to maintain a calm mind and desire, and thus the hemorrhoids disappeared. Hemorrhoids are associated with the body's internal heat (yang), while sea snails are cold in nature and salty, fitting the yin. Cold can counteract heat, and salt can soften hardness; bitter tea, being cool, contributes to this logic.

    The "Confucian Teachings on Caring for Parents" mentions: Mr. Zhao Yu frequently suffered from hemorrhoids and used various remedies such as phoenix-eye grass, hedgehog skin, locust roots, and raccoon tails. Some suggested using dried ginger powder, applied to roasted pork for consumption, but this led to dry and hardened stools, causing discomfort and swelling. After several days, he developed jaundice due to the illness. I treated him with several bouts of induced diarrhea, without mentioning the hemorrhoids; Dr. Ma casually noted this down. After Mr. Yu became acquainted with the person who applied the remedy, he did not suffer from hemorrhoids again.[183p]

    　　《丹溪心法》曰：许孺人产后痔作，疮有头如蒜头大，或下鲜血或紫血，大便疼，与黑神散。又多食肉大饱，此湿热在大肠所为，以(木郁)李仁、麻仁、槐角各七钱，枳实、皂角仁各五钱，苍朮、归尾、生地各三钱，大黄炒一钱，分六贴，内三样仁另研，煎服而愈。
    　　《医学纲目》曰：一女子脱肛，以糯米浓煎汁洗肛，将砖烧红，沃酢，青布铺其上，令温和，坐布上，肛自吸入。
    　　唐峡州王文显充西路安抚司判官，乘骡入骆谷，有痔疾，因此大作，其状如胡瓜，贯于肠头，热如溏灰火，至驿僵仆。主驿吏云：此病予曾患来，须灸即瘥。用柳枝浓煎汤先洗痔，便以艾炷其上，连灸三五壮，忽觉一道热气入肠中，因转泻鲜血，秽物一时出，至痛楚，泻后遂失胡瓜所在，登骡而驰去。[184p]

    The "Danxi Heart Method" states: After childbirth, Xu's woman developed hemorrhoids, with the sores having a head the size of a garlic bulb, sometimes discharging fresh or dark blood, and accompanied by painful bowel movements. This is due to excessive consumption of meat, indicating dampness and heat in the large intestine. Mix 7 qian each of wood-fragrant plum kernel, hemp seed, and sophora flower, and 5 qian each of bitter orange and soap pod; then mix 3 qian each of costus, angelica tail, and raw rehmannia, and 1 qian of stir-fried rhubarb. Divide into six doses, grinding the three kernels separately, and decoct for consumption to achieve recovery.

    The "Medical Essentials" states: A woman with rectal prolapse washed the anus with a thick decoction of glutinous rice, then heated a brick until red, soaked it in vinegar, laid a blue cloth over it to keep it warm, and sat on it, causing the anus to retract on its own.

    Wang Wenxian from Xiangzhou during the Tang Dynasty served as an official in the Western Route Pacification Office. He rode a mule into Luogu and developed hemorrhoids, which appeared like a gourd and obstructed the intestinal opening, feeling like intense heat from burning ash. He collapsed when he reached the post station. The head of the post station said: "I have suffered from this illness before; one must apply moxibustion to heal it." He used a strong decoction of willow branches to first wash the hemorrhoids, then applied moxa sticks on top and performed moxibustion for three to five sessions. Suddenly, he felt a warm sensation enter his intestines, followed by a violent discharge of fresh blood and feces, causing extreme pain. After the diarrhea, he no longer felt the presence of the gourd and rode away on the mule.[184p]

    　　《薛氏医案》曰：一人不慎酒色，患痔焮肿，肛门坠痛，下血便燥，脉洪大而濇，以当归(木郁)李仁汤加桃仁四剂少愈，更以四物汤加红花、桃仁、条芩、槐花数剂而愈。
    　　一人素有痔，劳役便脱肛，肿痛出水，中气下陷也。用补中益气汤加茯苓、芍药十余剂，中气复而愈。后复脱作痛，误服大黄丸，腹鸣恶食，几危。余用前汤加炮姜、芍药渐愈，后去姜加熟地、五味，三十余剂而愈。
    　　一人脾胃素弱，或因劳，或入房，肛门即下，肿痛甚，用补中益气汤加麦冬、五味兼六味丸而愈。后因过饮，下坠肿痛，悞用降火消毒，虚证蜂起。余用前汤加炮姜、木香一剂，再用前汤并加减八味丸，两月而安。
    　　一男子患痔，大便燥结，焮痛作渴，脉数，按之则实，以秦艽苍朮汤二剂少愈，更以四物汤加芩、连、槐花、枳壳四剂而愈。
    　　一人患痔成漏，每登厕则痛，以秦艽防风汤加条芩、枳壳四剂而愈，以四物加升麻、芩、连、荆、防，不复作。[185p]

    "The Medical Cases of the Xue Family" says: One person, through carelessness in drinking and indulgence, suffered from hemorrhoids with swelling, pain at the anus, blood in the stool, and dry bowel movements. The pulse was large and rapid. Using a decoction of Angelica (Mu Yu) and peach kernels, he improved slightly after four doses. Then, with Si Wu Decoction, plus safflower, peach kernels, Radix Scutellariae, and Sophora flower, he was cured after several doses.

    Another person had a chronic case of hemorrhoids; after labor, he suffered from rectal prolapse, swelling, pain, and discharge of pus, with qi deficiency. He took the Baizhong Yiqi Decoction with Poria and Peony for over ten doses, restoring his qi and achieving recovery. Later, he had a recurrence with pain, mistakenly took Da Huang pills, leading to abdominal rumbling and aversion to food, nearly putting him in danger. I used the previous decoction with roasted ginger and peony, and he gradually recovered, later replacing ginger with cooked Rehmannia and Schisandra, achieving recovery after over thirty doses.

    　　一男子臀漫肿，色不变，脉滑数而无力，此臀痈也，脓将成，尚在内。予欲治以托里药，待发出而用针。彼欲内消，服攻伐药，愈虚。复求治，仍投前药，托出针之，以大补药而愈。凡疮毒气已结不起者，但可补其血气，使脓速成而针去，不可论内消之法。脓成，又当辨其生熟浅深而针之。若大按之乃痛者，脓深也；小按之便痛者，脓浅也；按之不甚痛者，未成脓也；按之即复起者，有脓也。按之不复起者，无脓也。若肿高而软者，发于血脉；肿下而坚者，发于筋骨；肉色不相变者，发于骨髓也。

    A man had a swollen buttock, with no change in color, pulse slippery and rapid yet weak; this was an abscess on the buttock with pus likely to form, still internal. For abscesses that have chronic toxicity sealed inside, the only approach is to nourish the qi and blood to facilitate quicker pus formation and removal by acupuncture; internal dispersal methods should not be considered. Once pus is formed, it is important to differentiate its depth and maturity before acupuncture. If pressing down causes significant pain, the pus is deep; if it causes pain with slight pressure, the pus is shallow; if pressing does not cause much pain, pus has not yet formed; if pressing causes it to rise again, there is pus; if not, there is no pus. If the swelling is high and soft, it arises from blood and vessels; if it is firm and lower, it arises from tendons and bones; if the flesh color remains unchanged, it arises from bone marrow.

    　　一人年三十，脉如屋漏雀啄，臀痈肿硬，色夭，脓水清稀，悞服败毒之药。余曰：此足三阴亏损而药复伤也。余用六君加归、芪、附子一钱，二剂肿溃色赤；又减附子五分，数剂元气复而疮愈。
    　　一男子臀痈，硬痛发热，此膀胱气虚而湿热壅滞，用内托羌活汤二剂，热痛悉退；后用托里消毒散而溃；又用托里散四十余剂而敛。
    　　平湖袁上舍患痔，外傅寒凉，内服消毒，攻溃于臀，脓水清稀，脉洪大而数，寒热作渴，余辞不治，后果殁。此足三阴亏损之证，失滋化源，以致真气益虚，邪气愈甚矣，不死何俟！
    　　进士周希辅素有疝痔，劳则小腹作痛，茎出白津，痔亦肿痛，若饮食劳倦，起居失宜，则发寒内热，肢体疲倦，服十全大补汤，诸证并退。彼欲去病根，乃用攻病生肌之药，肌体骨立。余用益气汤、地黄丸，元气渐复，但自弛调摄，不能全愈。[194p]

    A man of thirty presented with a pulse resembling a leaking roof with sparrows pecking, accompanied by a hard swelling on the buttocks, a sallow complexion, and clear, thin pus.     Zhou Xifu, a successful graduate, had a history of hernias and hemorrhoids.     　　《寓意草》曰：旧邻治父母张受先先生，久患穿肠痔漏，气血大为所耗，有荐以吾乡黄生善敷割者，先生神其术，一切内治之药，并取决焉。不肖昌雅重先生文章道德之身，昔居瀛海时，曾令门人往候脉息，私商善后之策，大意谓，先生久困漏　，一旦平成，精气内荣，自可百年无患。然新造之区，尚未坚固，则有浸淫之虞；脏气久虚，肠蓄易澼，则有转注之虞。清气久陷，既服甘温升举矣，然漏下已多，阴血暗耗，恐毗于阳；水谷易混，既用养脏厚肠矣，然润剂过多，脾气易溜，恐毗于阴。且漏孔原通精孔，精稍溢出，势必旁渗，则豢精当如豢虎，厚味最足濡脾，味稍不节，势必走泄，则生阴无取伤阴。盖人身脾气，每喜燥而恶湿。先生漏孔已完，败浊下行者，无路可出，必转渗于脾，湿固倍之，是宜补脾之阳，勿伤脾之阴，以复健运之常，而收和平之益云云。[195p]

    The "Aesthetic Grass" says: In the past, a neighbor treated Master Zhang Shouxian, who had long suffered from anal fistula and was greatly drained of qi and blood. There was a recommendation for a good surgeon in our hometown, named Huang, who was skilled in cutting. The master trusted this technique and decided to take all internal medicines to remedy the issue. Unworthy Changya valued the master's literary and moral stature. In essence, he conveyed that after a long struggle with leakage, if one suddenly regains balance, the vital energy will flourish internally, and one could live a hundred years free of worries.

    However, in a newly established area, there is still the risk of infiltration; if the organs have been long deficient, the intestines are prone to rupture, creating the possibility of transference. If pure energy has long been stagnant and one has already taken sweet and warming foods to elevate their spirit, yet the leakage persists excessively, the dark consumption of yin blood becomes a concern; if food and water are easily mixed, and nourishing the organs to strengthen the intestines has been employed, but if excessive moistening agents are used, the spleen's energy could easily dissipate, posing a risk to yins.

    Furthermore, since the leakage path connects to the essence passage, if essence slightly overflows, it is bound to seep out sideways. Thus, nurturing essence should be like nurturing a tiger; it should be rich in flavor to nourish the spleen. If the flavor is not properly controlled, it will inevitably lead to leakage, resulting in a lack of benefit for yin. Indeed, the body's spleen energy prefers dryness and dislikes dampness. Once the leakage path is completed, the spoiling filth descends with no exit; it must inevitably seep into the spleen, exacerbating the dampness. Thus, one should supplement the yang of the spleen, without harming the yin of the spleen, to restore the regular functions and reap the benefits of balance.[195p]

    及至娄中，应召往诊，指下轻取鼓动有力，重按若觉微细，是阳未见不足，阴则大伤矣。先生每进补阴之药，则夜卧甚宁，肠澼亦稀，以致疡医妄引槐角、地榆治肠风下血之法治之，亦不觉其悞。其实漏病乃精窍之病，盖构精之时，气留则精止，气动则精泄。大凡强力入房者，气每冲激而出，故精随之横决，四射不尽，繇孔道而注，多溢于精管之外，久久渐成漏管。今漏管虽去，而肉中之空隙则存，填窍补隧，非此等药力所能胜也。[196p]

    When summoned to diagnose in the middle of the month, I lightly touched the pulse and found it strong; pressing harder revealed it to be faint, indicating that the Yang was insufficient while the Yin was severely harmed. Whenever the doctor administered supplements to replenish Yin, the patient would sleep soundly at night, and the intestines would also be loose. This led the ulcer doctor to mistakenly employ the methods of treating intestinal wind and blood loss with sophora and burnet, without realizing the error. In fact, the condition of leakage is a disease of the essence and orifices. When essence is being formed, if Qi is retained, the essence is stopped; if Qi is in motion, the essence leaks. Generally, when one forcefully enters the bedroom, the Qi often surges forth, causing the essence to spill out uncontrollably, flowing through the orifices and frequently overflowing beyond the seminal ducts, eventually forming a leak. Even though the leak may be addressed, the voids within the flesh remain. To fill the orifices and restore the conduits cannot be achieved by such medicinal powers.[196p]

    不肖姑不言其非，但于渠方中，去槐角、地榆等，而加鹿角霜一味，所谓惟有斑龙顶上珠，能补玉堂关下缺者是也。况群阴之药，最能润下，不有以砥之，则肠中之水，更澼聚可虞耶？然此特微露一斑耳。疡医不解，已沮为不可用。因思吾乡一治漏者，溃管生肌外，更有二神方。先以丸药半斤服之，令人阳道骤痿，俟管中肉满，管外致密，后以丸药半斤服之，令人阳道复兴。虽宜于少，未必宜于老，然用意亦大奇矣。不肖才欲填补窍隧，而黄生沮之，岂未闻此人此法乎？[197p]

    The unworthy practitioner does not speak of its flaws, but in the case of the patient, they remove things like the branches of locust trees and earthworm root, adding only deer antler frost. It is said that the only thing capable of filling the deficiencies beneath the jade hall is the pearl on the spotted dragon's head. If not fortified, might the fluids in the intestines become prone to excessive pooling? Yet, this is merely a faint hint of what is needed. A wound doctor is unable to understand and thus has deemed it unusable. I recall a practitioner in my hometown who treated leakage; when an ulcer formed, he applied a method with two divine formulas. First, he administered half a pound of pills, causing the vitality to suddenly diminish, allowing the flesh inside the canal to fill and the outside to become firm. Subsequently, he gave another half pound of pills, reviving the vitality again.     　　《外科正宗》曰：一男子患痔六年，每遇酒色劳役，痔则发肿，坚硬疼苦，十余日方得稍可。彼欲断其根，以枯痔散上至七日外，其痔渐黑，外有裂缝，至十六日痔枯脱落，扎若鸡心，以生肌散逐日用之，内服养血健脾药而愈。
    　　一男子患痔，焮肿作痛，大便结燥，脉数有力，以内疏黄连汤二服，便行痛止；又以四物汤如芩、连、枳壳、天花粉数剂而肿消；更以脏连丸一料而不复发。
    　　一男子患痔，凡遇劳苦发肿作痛，以枳壳汤熏洗，内服防风秦艽汤，数服痛肿顿减；令彼常洗前汤，每月五六次；内与六味地黄丸加黄蘗、知母服之，不发。[198p]

    The "Authentic Text on Surgery" states: A man suffered from hemorrhoids for six years. Whenever he engaged in drinking, indulgence, or heavy labor, the hemorrhoids would become swollen, hard, and painful, taking over ten days to improve slightly.     　　一男子好饮多欲，内痔虚坠下血，以四物汤加芩、连、升麻、葛根，数服，虚坠乃止；又以当归(木郁)李仁汤二剂，痔肿亦消；更服脏连丸月余，便血亦止。又月余兼节酒色，不发。
    　　一男子患痔十余年，头已穿溃，未及通肠，每发疼苦，以三品一条槍，插至七日，痔变黑色，疮边渐渐裂缝，至十五日脱落，以凤雏膏擦至半月，口敛而平。
    　　一男子怯弱，内痔便血，面色痿黄，自服凉血止血药不应，诊之脾脉虚而无力，此中气不能统血，以补中益气汤十余服，精神顿倍，便血亦少；又以加味四君子汤，兼前汤间服，月余不发。大抵此证所致之由不同，当究其因治之。如元气有余，形黑气盛，先粪而后紫血，更兼脉实有力者，此属有余，法当凉血止血药应自效。至若形体瘦弱，面色痿黄，先鲜血而后粪，更兼脉虚无力者，此属不足，岂可反用凉药止之，致伤脾胃？此证若不温中健脾，升举中气，其血不得归原，故药难效，伤其根本也。[199p]

    A man enjoyed drinking and had excessive desires, suffering from internal hemorrhoids with blood loss.     Generally, the causes of such symptoms vary; it is essential to identify the underlying reasons for treatment. For instance, if the vital energy is excessive, leading to dark and stagnant blood, the condition will present as fresh blood followed by feces, but the pulse will be strong. This indicates excess, and cooling and blood-stopping medicines should be effective. Conversely, if the body is thin and weak with a pale complexion, where fresh blood precedes feces and the pulse is weak, this signifies deficiency. It would be inappropriate to use cooling medicines in such cases, as they could harm the spleen and stomach. Therefore, if the symptoms do not warm and strengthen the spleen and uplift the middle Qi, the blood cannot return to normalcy, making effective treatment difficult and damaging the root cause.[199p]

    　　一男子患臀痈，四五日始生疼痛，至晚作寒，六脉浮而带数，以人参败毒散二剂，寒热顿退，疼痛稍止。彼值公务相关，欲出，乃用针点入患顶五六分，流去紫血，用蟾酥条插入，膏盖，以活血散瘀汤二服，次日流出紫血，随便可行；更服托里药五六服而安。
    　　一男子患臀痈六七日，焮痛发热，口干便燥，以托里消毒散，加花粉、大黄二服，便通渴止；仍用前汤加角针、山甲数服而脓溃；又以十全大补汤半月而敛。
    　　一男子患臀痈，坚硬不溃，此先寒凉之过也，以十全大补汤加皂针、苍朮、丹皮四剂，坚硬渐软；又以透脓散三服，脓熟针之，以前汤倍参、芪、归、朮月余而敛。

    A man suffered from a buttock abscess; after four or five days, he began to feel pain, and by evening, he developed chills. His pulse was floating and rapid.
